subject: VAM Haptic Modules & Simhub
description_text:
Order through Amazon - placed August 15, 2025  Order # 112-4233887-1764209

Hello, 
I am having a ton of issues with the VAM modules connecting with Simhub. It continuously states "searching for devices" regardless of what game is being played. I've tried running the SIMSONN manager along with the simhub and with it closed. It doesnt connect in either scenario. I have reset the SIMSONN hub, I've added a grounding wire from the hub to the pedal base, nothing working. Assetto Corsa seems to recognize the modules as they work properly but reflect "Searchig for devices"???? Rfactor 2 & LMU do not work correctly. The modules vibrate at odd times and off just crash as they vibrate consistently without a reason. 
AMS 2 seems to work intermittently. Not sure what's going on. I need help as all I've gotten is frustration. Please advise how to resolve.
Thanks
Richard Burns

conversations.body_text: Hi Rick Burns,   Could you please provide your order number, and also take a photo of the Simsonn Manager software interface along with the pedal’s motor installation? I’ll check the issue for you.      If this happens, it indicates that the computer’s grounding is not reliable, possibly because a three-prong plug was not used with a three-prong wall outlet. You can refer to the post below: connect the computer case to the stand, and connect the control box to the metal screws on the pedals. This should resolve the disconnection issue.     https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding

Hello, 
 Order #  112-4233887-1764209








Please note that there is no disconnect message, it's not connecting at all. The modules work in Assetto Corsa although they are listed as "searching for device". This can't be a grounding issue. 
I'd have issues with other peripherals, not just yours. 
Regards,
Rick Burns

Hi Rick Burns,     Please connect an additional grounding wire to your PC case, and then manually update the firmware again following the procedure below.      ProX / ProX Ultra Pedal Firmware Update Procedure:    Press and hold the Upgrade button on the control box;    Reconnect the USB cable;    The software will indicate that the device has entered “Simsonn Flasher mode”;    In the software, go to: Settings → Update → Manual Firmware Update → pedals → firmware → pedals-proxultra.sfu (If it’s a ProX pedal, select pedals-prox.sfu)    Start the firmware update, and once it is complete, release the Upgrade button;    Finally, retest and calibrate the pedals.

Hi Rick Burns,    We asked about your time zone only to confirm whether it’s daytime or nighttime on your side, so we don’t contact you at an inconvenient time.  Please follow the steps below to troubleshoot:    Uninstall the old software, then download and install the latest SIMSONN Manager 2.1.3 from our official website (this version fixes the telemetry issues with LMU and rF2);    Update the firmware to: CPU1: 2.0.6 / CPU2: 2.0.4;    Please connect the pedals directly to a rear USB 3.0 (blue) port on your PC — do not use a USB hub;    Secure the power connectors for both the control box and the haptic/vibration power supply (zip ties recommended) to prevent wobbling, which can cause intermittent disconnects.    Also, a small spark when connecting power is normal. It happens when the controller’s motor capacitors charge up. Since it’s 24V, there is no safety risk and it will not damage the control board. Please rest assured.
